newsitem.title: USA: Spine-Tech surges on earnings surprise.
newsitem.headline: Spine-Tech surges on earnings surprise.

text.p: Shares of Spine-Tech Inc jumped about 15 percent Wednesday after the company reported second quarter revenues and earnings that exceeded analyst expectations.
The company also said Tuesday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved a laparoscopic procedure developed by the company for its BAK interbody spinal fusion system.

"It was mostly the earnings surprise and a little bit the FDA," Thomas Gunderson, analyst at Piper Jaffray, said of the stock move Wednesday. Analysts said the FDA approval was expected, though the timing was not certain.

The company reported revenues of $14.2 million and earnings of $0.25 a share for the quarter. Analysts said they had expected revenues closer to $12 million and that earnings estimates were between about $0.12 and $0.18 a share.

"The primary reason for the jump in EPS was $2 million more in revenue, (with) operating expenses $1 million less than expected," said Wade King, senior research analyst at Robertson Stephens. King said he raised his fiscal 1997 earnings estimate to $0.90 from $0.60 a share. The company, which received initial FDA approval for its product in September, posted a loss in 1996.
Gunderson also raised his estimate, to a profit of $0.93 a share for 1997 from $0.67 a share.
"What helps them is they had a faster ramp up of sales," he said. "This is only their third quarter since FDA approval.
Spine-Tech shares were up 7-1/4 at 54-1/4 Wednesday.
